did.abstract: Footage of UM astronomy professor and number one football fan Hazel Losh suffering a heart attack on sidelines during a UM football game. Features: Hazel Losh, UM-Astron.
Footage of fall foliage on the Diag and other parts of campus, also pan shots of Palmer field and the hill dormitories, and students walking about campus.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 230; 300

did.abstract: Footage shot from the Goodyear blimp includes good views of the Law Quad, Central Campus, the Medical Campus, downtown Ann Arbor, and Michigan Stadium - empty and full.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 1000; 1000

did.abstract: Aerial views of campus including good shots of North Campus and an empty Michigan Stadium. Also brief footage of UM-Dearborn and UM-Flint campuses.
Footage of the UM Alumni Marching Band and the Marching Band performing at half-time of a football game, shots of the crowd in Michigan Stadium and a few football plays.
Footage of UM President Robben Fleming's resignation announcement. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres. ; Sally Fleming

did.abstract: UM choral group performs a number of "Michigan" songs. Features: Amaizin' Blues

did.abstract: UM choral group performs a medley of Michigan songs. (Filmed for the Alumni Association film "We Came to Ann Arbor.")Features: Amaizin' Blues

did.abstract: Film footage of still photos of early UM athletic teams, coaches and athletic events. (Filmed for the Alumni Association film "We Came to Ann Arbor.)
Film footage of still photos of campus events and personalities from the early 1900s and of campus artifacts such as athletic programs, and dance posters.

Footage of interviews with UM alumni who have returned to campus for graduation, shots of various campus scenes, the Union, Ferry Field, graduates with their parents. (Filmed for Alumni Association film "We Came to Ann Arbor.)

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 800; 800

did.abstract: Additional footage of interviews with alumni at various spots around campus.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 300; 300

did.abstract: Close-up and pan shots of football fans in Michigan Stadium.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 115; 115

did.abstract: Footage from the College of Engineering fund raising broadcast includes a variety of shots of campus particularly of Engineering Arch and North Campus engineering facilities, engineering labs, classrooms, and faculty. Pres. Fleming speaks from NC. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.

Film footage of still photographs of many UM professors, campus scenes, fraternity houses, and campus social events. (Apparently for the Alumni Association film "We Came to Ann Arbor," most photos are b/w.)

Footage of several campus buildings including an Art School studio, a chemistry lab, and a Dental School lab. Also shot of Prof. Robert Angell standing in front of Angell Hall and of a theatre class rehearsing.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; pos, col; col, sil; sil, 183; 190

did.abstract: Film of the arrival from England of the new set of bells for the Baird Carillon, shows the bells being picked up at the Detroit harbor, transported to Ann Arbor and installed in Burton Tower.
Footage showing a variety of student housing: university married student apartments, single dwellings, apartments, a fraternity house (Dental School Fraternity,) sorority house, student dorms.

Film of dedication of new addition to Michigan Union on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the Union's founding, footage of Union activities and facilities including the swimming pool, bowling alley, study areas, main desk, and sleeping rooms.
Footage of UM mens gymnastics team in competition at Crisler Arena. (1970s?)

A filmed tour of the TVC studios with explanations of equipment, facilities, and the working of the studio. Apparently produced for presentation to the UM Board of Regents to demonstrate the work of the TVC.
Short clips from a number of University of Michigan Television Center programs broadcast in the previous several years. Apparently compiled for presentation to the UM Board of Regent's.
Footage of a ceremony held on the steps of the Michigan Union marking the 20th anniversary of Pres. Kennedy's announcement of his plan for the Peace Corps.

Footage of a ceremony held on the steps of the Michigan Union marking the 20th anniversary of Pres. Kennedy's announcement of his plan for the Peace Corps. Includes remarks by former director Sargent Shriver, Edmund Muskie, Sam Brown and others. Features: Harold Shapiro UM-Pres. ; Richard Celeste

Continues coverage of ceremony marking 20th anniversary of the Peace Corps. Includes remarks by Sargent Shriver, Richard Celeste, and Yolanda King. Features: Sargent Shriver ; Richard Celeste ; Yolanda King ; G. Mennen Williams

Continues coverage of ceremony marking 20th anniversary of the Peace Corps. Includes remarks by Sargent Shriver, Richard Celeste, and current director Sam Brown. Features: Sargent Shriver ; Richard Celeste ; Sam Brown
Continues coverage of ceremony marking 20th anniversary of the Peace Corps. Includes remarks by UM regent Sarah Power and Sec. of State Edmund Muskie. Features: Sarah Power, UM-Regent ; Edmund Muskie

Continues coverage of ceremony marking 20th anniversary of the Peace Corps. Includes conclusion of Sec. of State Edmund Muskie's remarks and an exchange with protesters, and Pres. Shapiro's closing statement. Features: Edmund Muskie ; Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres.

did.unittitle: Maggie Kuhn / Ralph Nader Interview on Co-ops 1979
did.abstract: Maggie Kuhn, leader of the "Grey Panthers" and an advocate of the cooperative movement discusses the philosophy of cooperative living and economic institutions and the cooperative movement's relation to consumerism and other social movements. Features: Maggie Kuhn

did.unittitle: Maggie Kuhn / Ralph Nader Interview on Co-ops 1979
did.abstract: Conclusion of Kuhn interview and interview with consumer advocate Ralph Nader on the role of consumer and other cooperative organizations. Features: Maggie Huhn ; Ralph Nader

Footage of the inaugural ceremony of UM President Harold Shapiro. Includes procession into Hill Aud., introduction of regents and former presidents, remarks by Hanna Gray, Irving Shain, and representatives of UM faculty, students and alumni. Features: Hanna Gray ; Irving Shain ; Richard Cochran, UM-Med.
This tape of the inauguration of UM Pres. Harold Shapiro duplicates #480a but also includes the remarks of Saul Hymans of the UM Economics Dept. Features: Saul Hymans, UM-Econ.

Footage of a farewell banquet for UM former president Robben Fleming and Sally Fleming, includes remarks by UM regents Sarah Power and Dean Baker and former Chrysler president Lynn Townsend. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres. ; Sarah Power, UM-Regent ; Dean Baker, UM-Regent ; Lynn Townsend

Continues footage of a farewell banquet for former UM Pres. Robben Fleming and Sally Fleming, includes remarks by UM regent Sarah Power, Robben Fleming, and Sally Fleming. Features: Sarah Power, UM-Regent ; Robben Fleming, UM-Pres. ; Sally Fleming
Continues footage of farewell banquet for former UM president robben Fleming and Sally Fleming, includes remarks by Robben Fleming. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.

Footage of special regents' meeting to announce the appointment of Harold Shapiro as new UM president. Regent Nederlander discusses the selection process and other regents comment. (Most of the time camera is on Shapiro while regents speak.)Features: Robert Nederlander, UM-Regent ; Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres., Allan Smith, UM-Law

Continues coverage of a special regents' meeting announcing appointment of Harold Shapiro as new UM president. Includes comments by interim president Allan Smith and Shapiro. Features: Allan Smith, UM-Law ; Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres.

Continues coverage of a special regents' meeting announcing appointment of Harold Shapiro as new UM president. Includes a statement by Shapiro, introduction of Shapiro's family, and a brief interview with Shapiro. Features: Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres.
Footage of a Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint sponsored by UM-Flint and the Michigan Council for the Humanities. Includes opening remarks and talk by Al Rightly, former UAW official.
Continues coverage of the Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint.
Continues coverage of Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint.
Continues coverage of Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint.
Continues coverage of Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint, including address by Dr. Rollo May. Features: Rollo May
Continues coverage of Conference on Work and Leisure in Flint, includes conclusion of address by Rollo May and discussion. Features: Rollo May
Highlights of Robben Fleming's statement announcing his resignation as president of the University of Michigan and excerpts from the following press conference. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.

Complete footage of Robben Fleming's statement announcing his resignation as president of the University of Michigan and statements by members of the Board of Regents. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.
Continues coverage of Robben Fleming's resignation as president of the University of Michigan, includes statements by members of the Board of Regents. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.
Continues coverage of Flemings resignation as president of the University of Michigan, includes a press conference held by Fleming. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.

A short feature on "the small white house" that is the home of the University of Michigan's Center for Chinese Studies, explains the history and role of the Center and the contributions of UM faculty to development of US-China relations. Features: Allen Whiting

Apparently filmed for TVC programs on the Great Lakes, 27 tapes consist of raw footage of a variety of scenes of commercial and recreational use of the lakes, scientific studies of marine life and pollution problems. Includes some interviews.

physdesc.physfacet: u-matic tape, col, sound, ca. 20:00 per tape

did.abstract: Twelve 30-minute tapes of scenes in and around Pigeon River Country State Forest. Includes shots of the forest, wildlife, park facilities, foresters working, and footage shot along the Pigeon River.

physdesc.physfacet: 12 u-matic tapes, col, sil, ca. 30:00 per tape

did.abstract: Six tapes of footage of the 1978 race from Dexter to Ann Arbor.
Brief footage of the facades and entrances of University Hospital and the Simpson Memorial Institute for Medical Research at the University of Michigan.
A NBC special report by Dick Schaap on how athletics and academics coexist at the University of Michigan.

Hazen Schumacher interviews newly inaugurated UM President Harold Shapiro who discusses his views on the relationship of the university administration to the faculty and the student body and his goals for the university. Features: Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres. ; Hazen Schumacher, UM-TVC

Shapiro discusses the development of the UM-Flint Campus and the role WFUM-TV, the university's public television station, can play in forming bonds between the campus and the Flint community. Features: Harold Shapiro, UM-Pres. ; Hazen Schumacher, UM-TVC

did.unittitle: Prof. Alfred Meyer on the Lecture
did.abstract: UM political science professor Alfred Meyer is filmed lecturing a class on the role of the lecture in the educational process and the techniques of effective lecturing. Features: Alfred Meyer, UM-Pol. Sci.
Short film of UM basketball team at practice in Crisler Arena.
Footage of Robben Fleming in front of Burton Tower in film to kickoff the UM United Way Fund Drive. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.
Footage of a luncheon for Ford Lemmler, longtime head of the UM Audio-Visual Education Center, on his last day of work, includes shots of many members of AVEC staff. Features: Ford Lemmler, UM-AVEC
Highlights from University of Michigan football games in 1977. (A total of 14 films on cores, total length is approximately 1000 feet.)

Footage of Antarctica shot by TVC crew for program "Man and Continent 7" includes aerial shots of Antarctic landscape, scenes of the camp at Murdoch Bay, and a shot of a UM flag flying near the South Pole.

Footage of the "Varsity Night" celebration in Hill Auditorium before the Ohio State football game, includes comments by Wallie Webber, performances by the UM Band, and a trampoline act. (See also Series S "Varsity Night Highlights."Features: Walter Webber; Dick Kimball, Don Cole
Continues footage of the "Varsity Night" activities, includes a trampoline comedy routine and performances by various UM bands and orchestras.
Continues footage of the "Varsity Night" activities, includes performances by the UM Band a singer, and a student "playing his hands.

Footage of sculptor Richard Hunt at work in his Chicago studio constructing sculptures for Bentley Library courtyard, installation of Hunt's sculptures in the courtyard of the Bentley Library, .Footage of Hunt's studio and the arrival and installation of sculptures at Bentley Library (3 originals combined in one reel). Features: Richard Hunt

Narrated film on the expansion of the UM campus uses historical photographs and current film footage, includes shots of central campus buildings and north campus labs and construction sites. Apparently a promotional film for the Engineering College.
Film footage of campus and Ann Arbor buildings including UM dormitories, University Hospital, the Observatory, the Pretzel Bell, Metzgers, Blue Front, and street scenes.

Film footage of campus buildings including the Power Center, Art and Architecture, Business Administration, South Quad, West Quad, Bentley Library, Fraternity Houses, Law Quad, Music School, Bursely dormitory, the Diag, and Ann Arbor train station.
Original printing materials for a program on the dedication of the Towsley Center for Continuing Medical Education. (Includes A and B rolls and B-wind sound track.
Original footage filmed for use in the Engineering College recruiting film includes footage of the Engineering College's electric car, the Aerospace Dept. airplane, and classroom scenes.
Footage of an engineering student using an electron scanning microscope.
Original footage of campus building includes aerial of campus and shots of Engineering Arch, East Engineering, the diag, Rackham Building, the Law Quad, and North campus Engineering Buildings.

Footage of the UM engineering students and professor working on the UM electric car, students working in the UM automotive lab, students and staff working in various Engineering offices and professors working at a computer.
Footage of engineering students studying, in class, and working in laboratories.

Footage of an interview with UM basketball coach Johnny Orr, filmed in his office, at a team practice and at his home with his family. Also brief clips of UM women's basketball, gymnastics and swimming team during practices. Features: Johnny Orr, UM-Ath.

Original film footage of scenes from the premier performance of Arthur Miller's play "Up From Paradise" at the Power Center. Miller appears briefly at beginning of film. (Some footage is quite dark.)Features: Arthur Miller
Footage of the opening night crowd in the lobby of the Power Center for Arthur Miller's play "Up From Paradise."
Film of dedication of a plaque marking fifth anniversary of the Peace Corps and honoring volunteers and parts of a talk on the Peace Corps in Michigan Union Ballroom. (Partial sound.)
Film footage of still photographs of John Kennedy on steps of Michigan Union announcing plans for creation of a Peace Corps.

did.abstract: Footage of a rocket launch from site in Northern Michigan on shore of Lake Superior, NASA and Goddard Space Center trucks with data recording equipment and computers. (Film from station WLUC, Marquette, Mich.)
Original, unedited footage of the Medical Science Building and laboratories and the Chemistry Building and laboratories. (One-inch tape no. 619.)
Unedited, original footage of an interview with Ann Arbor harmonica virtuoso Peter "Madcat" Ruth. (One-inch videotape no. 620.)Features: Peter "Madcat" Ruth
Footage for a recruiting tape for the University of Michigan-Flint. (Two one-inch tapes, nos. 624, 638.)

Assorted footage of activities related to Project Vesiac, apparently an international geologic project. Includes a number of reels, b/w and color, approximately 1400 feet, footage of seismic tests and data recording equipment.

did.abstract: Speech class production, footage of a tea with UM President Robben Fleming. (Two-inch tape no. 645.)

An orientation film for new University of Michigan employees, Pres. Fleming welcomes them to the staff and Henry Austin outlines U of M employment procedures and benefits. Features: Robben Fleming, UM-Pres.; Henry Austin

Eleven cans of raw footage, apparently produced for an NET program on noted educators, features UM prof. Abraham Kaplan. Includes shots of Kaplan lecturing, leading discussion, and being interviewed, also shots of campus and Ann Arbor scenes. Features: Abraham Kaplan, UM-Phil.
Footage of crowd arriving at Hill Auditorium for a May Festival Concert.
Various still shots of Kennedy, possibly to be included in some other film.

Former UM coach and phys-ed instructor demonstrates use of the "Indian Clubs" as form a calisthenics. Formerly a part of phys-ed routine, sometimes referred to as "Swedish system" of gymnastics or calisthenics. Features: Simmons, Ken, UM-Phys-Ed.

Sesquicentennial films #1-6 contain footage of a variety of special events held in conjunction with the observance of the University of Michigan's sesquicentennial. These films are numbered 300, 307, 315, 316, 317, 320.

Original film shot for public service films on the U-M Extension Service, including (according to note with the films) campus scenes, traveling in parts of Michigan, art fairs, parks, lecturer, independent study, fire training, real estate certificate program, teacher in classroom, community colleges, Extension Service News, miscellaneous extension brochures, Rackham Symphony Choir (4 reels)

"Games" Film shot for a public service message on gaming research at the U-M; (originals, workprints and mag sound reel)

Footage of a Gov. Williams' press conference, he discusses the impact of a growing population of older citizens and the importance of developing training programs for the aged. Features: G. Mennen Williams
Various shots of synchronized swimming by UM swimming group. (B-wind rev.)Features: Michifish
Film of a UM student soap box derby competition. (B-wind rev.)
Shots of various building sites on North Campus, includes clearing of land, road construction, excavating, and shots V.A. Hospital and Phoenix Memorial Laboratory Building.

Footage of the Japanese Crown Prince's visit to UM Campus, possibly for dedication of the UM Japan Center. Includes shots of motorcade, Akihito walking with Pres. Hatcher, signing book at an exhibition, greeting people. Features: Akihito, Japanese Crown Prince, ;Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

Various events filmed during College of Engineering Centennial. Shots of dignitaries in Hill Auditorium, Charles Wilson addressing crowd, robed dignitaries, Wilson receives degree from Pres. Hatcher. Features: Charles Wilson, Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, (B-wind rev., needs repair) wp, b/w, sil, 45

did.abstract: Address given at dedication of Cooley Laboratory. Ribbon cutting at doors is filmed.
Series of shots of old cars, parked on campus, and being driven, some engines are shown, ladies in costume, Close-up of sign "Veteran Motor Car Club of America", parade.
Footage of the UM ROTC marching band at Ferry Field, Prof. Carter and officers review the band. Features: Prof. Carter

did.unittitle: Pres. Hatcher & Regents at Willow Run 1954
did.abstract: Various shots of Pres. Hatcher and Regents on runway near plane before they leave for the Philippines. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

did.unittitle: Haile Selassie Visits U of M
did.abstract: Haile Selassie, Emperor of Ethiopia, is filmed in academic gown, on stage in Rackham Lecture Hall, at a reception, on tour of campus, and at a dinner. Features: Haile Selassie
Footage of an anthropologist working in lab, grinding up long bone and mixing it in test tube. (64'), also measuring skull and demonstrating various measurements and the tools used.

Various shots of construction work at studio, moving in camera and cables, lights, moving into studio with views of interiors. Interior views of equipment, studio party, inside control room. (B-wind, rev)
Film of Burmese leader U Nu on visit to UM, includes shots of U Nu and Pres. Hatcher in front of the Clements Library and at the President's House. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres., U Nu

Academic Procession.; Footage from the dedication of Haven Hall and Mason Hall, Pres. Hatcher leading the academic procession past Haven and into Mason, close-ups of the UM mace-holder and several faculty members. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

Footage of the unveiling of a plaque in Mason Hall by Hatcher and a student, shots of assorted robed faculty and administration, Pres. Hatcher leaving after ceremonies. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres., UM Faculty, UM Administrators
Footage from ceremony dedicating UM Japan Center, includes shots of speakers and exhibits.
Additional footage from Japan Center dedication, includes shots of displays, the Japanese room, close-ups of dolls, and Japanese flower arrangements.

Footage of early UM Television Center productions for broadcast on WWJ-TV, shots of rehearsals, a take of variety show, interviews, a play, and Professor Eldersveld lecturing. Features: Samuel Eldersveld, UM-Pol. Sci.

Footage from the dedication of the new women's swimming pool, includes shots of the exterior of the building, women swimming and playing water polo, the Michifish synchronized swim club, and Harlan Hatcher doing the dedication. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.; Michifish
Footage taken at the UM Fire College, includes shots of demonstrations on handling a gas truck fire.
Footage of a UM scientist using an electron microscope.
Film from dedication of the Civil Defense Building, various exterior shots of the building.

Various shots of Dedication of Civil Defense Building, President Hatcher and audience, various speakers, crowd. Also shown are dorm facilities, office, classroom, kitchen, truck, and garage. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

did.unittitle: U of M Foundry, Metallurgical Laboratory
did.abstract: Footage of equipment and activities at the UM foundry and metallurgical laboratory, including shots of tension test, CU of machine, shots of microscope, polishing process, and the pouring of metals into mold.
Film of the UM Dearborn Center under construction, shots of Fairlane gardens, downtown Dearborn, Ford Motor Co. central administration building.
A small amount of footage of old Detroit, horse and carriage with groom, an old fire house. Most of footage is of modern traffic in downtown Detroit, street signs, angle shots of traffic.
Random shots of rockets being launched, in flight, landing. Clips from government film "Prelude to the IGY", transporting missiles, launching large missiles.
Footage of UM[?] rockets being prepared for launching, shots of surrounding equipment and activity. Shots of two unsuccessful launches with rockets exploding in sky, then a successful launch.
Footage shot in a German submarine includes shot of control panel, view through the periscope, a torpedo launch, and damage at torpedo target site.

Footage of the ruins of the city of Hiroshima shortly after explosion of the atomic bomb, includes film from plane of bomb being dropped, the explosion, and mushroom clouds, U.S. soldiers in city shortly after blast. (A War Dept. film?)
Footage of John McCone chairman of the U.S. Atomic Energy Commission and Prof. Yemelyanof, chief of the Russian Atomic Program for Peaceful Purposes, at singing of an agreement on atomic energy.
Footage from the film "A Tale of Two Cities," shows destruction of Nagasaki by the atomic bomb.
Silent footage of interview of Albert Einstein. Features: Albert Einstein
Interview of Madame Chiang Kai-Shek shot in UM TV Studio. (3 neg. and 3 workprints, 2 magnetic sound tracks.) Features: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

did.abstract: Jaques Soustelle, former minister in French cabinet and critic of DeGaulle's Algeria policy, is interviewed in UM studio by Jean Carduner of the UM French Dept. Features: Jaques Soustelle, Jean Carduner, UM-French Dept.

Footage from dedication of Fairlane Mansion at UM Dearborn Center, Pres. Hatcher is filmed at a news conference, also Hatcher engaged in conversation following meeting. (auricon Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.
Footage from dedication of Fairlane Mansions at UM Dearborn Center, footage is similar though not identical to #38a, shot of Hatcher arriving in UM car. (arriflex.) Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.
Film shot through telescope at McMath Observatory, shows, in order, a satellite, Saturn, Mars, Moon craters, Saturn, Mars.
Footage of solar prominences taken through telescope at UM McMath Observatory, at Lake Angelus, Pontiac, Mich.

Footage of the UM radio telescope at McMath Observatory, includes shots of UM, shows William Howard working with knobs and books, close-ups of the telescope, crystal receiver, and parabolic receiver. Features: William Howard
Exterior and interior of Mt. Palomar Observatory.
Footage of the Leningrad observatory, including some shots of the surrounding area.

Various shots of fountains designed by Richard Jennings. Also shots of fountains around Detroit which were not Jenning's designs. (Includes original negative trims, used in TVC production "Sculpture From a Pump" Series B #419.)Features: Richard Jennings

did.unittitle: Atoms for Peace Conference at UM 1955
did.abstract: Footage from the UM Atoms for Peace Conference focusing on the UM Phoenix Project, including shots of Hatcher at luncheon with dignitaries, a model of the Phoenix Lab., construction site, the slave manipulator, and various exhibits. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres., Ralph Sawyer, UM-V.P., H.J.Gomberg, UM-Eng.

did.unittitle: Atoms for Peace Conference at UM 1955
did.abstract: Footage of participants in the UM sponsored Atoms for Peace Conference, includes shots of many foreign delegates, nuclear laboratory apparatus, and groups touring the labs.

Footage of an eruption of Hawaii's Mt. Kilaueau, shots of volcano erupting, lava being shot into air, lava flowing down the mountain, the existing lava fields, and molten lava streaming into the ocean.

A U.S. Dept. of Agriculture film on Soviet agriculture apparently filmed on a tour of Russia, includes shots of rural countryside, farmers using modern and traditional machines and techniques, an agricultural fair, a farming village and city scenes.
Original footage shot for the film "Football Weekend in Ann Arbor"

Original footage shot for the film "Football Weekend in Ann Arbor", includes shots outside stadium, pre-game ceremonies, cheerleaders, band playing, stadium crowd, cars parked outside the stadium. Shots of St. Mary's Chapel, St. Andrews Church features: Cheerleaders, Marching Band

Shots of band in formations in stadium, crowd shots, cheerleaders, crowd leaving stadium, scoreboard, team coming on the field, football plays, cars and crowd outside stadium leaving, State Street. Short shots of campus, stadium. Features: Cheerleaders, Marching Band
Random short shots, entering stadium, marching band, campus, Burton Tower, game, cheerleaders, cars parking, crowd shots, cleanup crew in empty stadium. Features: Marching Band, Cheerleaders

Random shots of crowds entering stadium, State St. at night, night shots around town, band on the field, press box, crowd, team on field, Prof. Revelli, Burton Tower, cleaning up post-game, various vendors in stadium, cars, picnic. Features: William D. Revelli, UM-Music, Marching Band
Two part film, UM-Marching Band on the field, pep rally at night. Features: Marching Band

Random shots of homecoming displays, baton twirler on field, homecoming displays under construction at night, pep rally at night. Outside stadium in late Fall, parked cars, band on field, Prof. Revelli, cheerleaders on field, Band Day. Features: Marching Band, William D. Revelli, UM-Music, Cheerleaders

Random shots of football crowd in stands, band on the field, Little Brown Jug, Coke truck, empty stadium, card section, shots around the stadium, Fritz Crisler, homecoming displays, homecoming displays under construction at night. Features: Marching Band, H.O. "Fritz" Crisler

Footage from six football games in Michigan Stadium in 1955-1956. Shots are from the sidelines and press deck, scoreboard cutaways. Games filmed are Michigan State, Army, Northwestern Univ., Minnesota, Illinois, Indiana.
Chinese Studies.; Professor Crump is filmed teaching a class in Chinese studies. Filmed for Series I, "Inquiring Minds."Features: James I. Crump, UM-Far East Lang.
Various shots of experiments with Planaria. Filmed for the program "Heads and/or Tales" Series B #411.

Political Science Teaching.; Various shots of Harold Jacobson teaching a political science course re/arms control, and tension between East and West. Filmed for Series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: Harold Jacobson, UM-Pol. Sci.
Psychology.; Various shots of psychology Richard Cutler in nursery. Filmed for series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: Richard Cutler, UM-Psych.
Art.; Professor Lewis conducting an art class outside the Architecture and Design Building. Filmed for the Series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: William A. Lewis, UM-Art
Mathematics.; Footage of Professor Brumfield teaching a class in new mathematics. Filmed for the Series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: Professor Brumfield, UM-Mathematics
Zoology.; Professor Rizki teaching a lab in genetics. Filmed for the Series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: Tahir Rizki, UM-Zool.
Geography.; Professor Tobler teaching a course in cartography. Filmed for the Series I program "Inquiring Minds."Features: Waldo Tobler, UM-Geog.
Footage (ca. 1950?) of Russian school children in class, skating, dancing, swimming, doing farm and factory work. (Footage obtained for use in the TVC program "Ivan Goes to School.")
Shots of medical students in lab, good close-ups of lab equipment, students in lounge and lecture halls.
Shots of students being enrolled, life on campus--classes, lab work. Students attending seminars and working in the hospital, treating patients.
Many shots of the University of Michigan Botanical Gardens.

Madam Chiang Kai-Shek is filmed arriving at airport, greeted by Pres. Hatcher, in UM Far Eastern library, presented with hood at ceremony, giving a speech, at a reception, on hospital tour. Features: Madam Chiang Kai-Shek, Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

Random shots of archeologists digging to find remains, discovering pieces of pottery, mud walls, broken bowl, bricks in a pattern. Sketches on the walls. More trench digging. Features: Griffin, James B. UM-Anthro.

Film produced for the Air Research and Development Command Aerospace Medical Laboratory shows simulations of weightlessness used in astronaut training in a centrifuge machine and on board a airplane in rapid descent.

The group of films titled "Germany" consist of newsreel and documentary type footage acquired by the TVC for use in the Series I program"Germany Today." Film was apparently obtained from the National Archives, the War Dept. and other sources.

Films include footage of Hitler and other German military and political leaders, war footage, NAZI party rallies, post-war social and industrial conditions, the allied occupation of Germany, the establishment of East German Government

post-war political activity in East and West Germany and post-war leaders Konrad Adenauer, Willy Brandt, and Walter Ulbricht. All films are silent and black and white. There may be negatives, work prints, or air prints.
For more detailed listings of images on each film see the "Film File" card index in box of the Michigan Media collection.
Footage of Konrad Adenauer, Willy Brandt, members of the West German Bundestag, political rallies, and Charles De Gaulle.

Footage includes a NAZI rally, Hitler addressing a crowd and visiting wounded soldiers, and Hitler on board a ship. Also footage of a Japanese naval convoy, Japanese shelling of an island, and Pearl Harbor.

Footage of recreational and leisure activities in post-war Germany including, Oktoberfest, card playing, modern dance. Also shots of Heidelberg, German agriculture, housewives at work, and German railroads.
Footage of a tank in the streets of Nuremberg, rubble of a battle scarred city, POWs marching, fighting in a city.

Footage of U.S. occupation troops, a POW camp, Gen. Lucius Clay, the Berlin airlift, Winston Churchill and Harry Truman at Potsdam Conference, a political rally in Austria, and German industrial facilities.
Footage of U.S. and Russian troops, the Berlin blockade, an Edward R. Murrow film clip, Konrad Adenauer at NATO meeting, NATO troops, voting in Rumania, Stalin reviewing troops, and British soldiers.
Footage of a German military parade, soldiers being fitted for uniforms and taking oaths, a class of officer candidates, a U.S. army parade.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, wp; neg, b/w; b/w, sil; sil, 400;400

did.abstract: Footage, apparently from an anti-Nazi film, includes shots of Hitler speaking, in a parade, and in a railroad car, concentration camps, Nazi rallies, German soldiers marching, and prisoners being marched off blindfolded.
Footage includes shots of meeting of Axis leaders, Hitler greeting dignitaries and reviewing troops, bombed and burning buildings, battles on the eastern and Italian front, and the Berlin airlift.
Shots of Hitler and Mussolini, Hitler speaking to large crowd, NAZI airplanes in dog fights and on bombing missions, Japanese troops and a naval convoy.
Footage of West Berlin factories and power plant, President Roosevelt addressing Congress, and an American NAZI Party meeting.

Footage of the E. German parliament in session, Walter Ulbricht and other E. German communists, Red Army entering Berlin, film of Stalin, Lenin, and Ulbricht, building Berlin Wall, E. German agriculture, Kruschev in East Berlin, and damaged Berlin.
Footage of Konrad Adenauer, reconstruction of war damage, and a variety of domestic family scenes.

Miscellaneous footage relating to plot to assassinate Hitler, Nazi rallies, funeral of a Nazi leader, Hitler in airplane viewing a bombed out city, Germany's northern defenses, signing of Munich agreement, and occupation of the Sudentenland.

Includes a variety of battle and war damage scenes, NAZI army in France, French surrender, Hitler and staff, Mussolini addressing crowd, also shots of Douglas MacArthur at U.S. Army HQ and Pres. Roosevelt at desk, U.S. factories producing war goods.
Miscellaneous footage of German industry and agriculture, Hamburg harbor, Berlin Wall, Free University of Berlin, student social life, concentration camps, and war refugees.

Footage includes Brandenburg Gate, E. German agriculture and industry, signing of European Economic Community pact, Winston Churchill, Harry Truman, John Kennedy in Berlin, Willy Brandt, Konrad Adenauer, 1953 revolt, Berlin parade, and Hitler.
Footage of German soldiers and military equipment.

Footage of end of war celebrations, the Yalta Conference, Postsdam Conference, Harry Truman, Gen. Lucius Clay, Walter Ulbricht, Berlin blockade and airlift, Berlin Wall and Check-Point-Charlie, Russian soldiers in Berlin, and war refugees.
Footage of the Berlin Wall and escapes from East Berlin, refugees, a pro-Russian march and demonstration, and East German border guards.
Footage depicting the social fabric of Germany includes family scenes, athletic events, industrial activity, street scenes, also Hitler addressing a crowd, refugees, and a bombed out city.
Footage of German court scenes, Gestapo police methods, Nuremburg trials, also shot of Gen. Eisenhower.
Miscellaneous footage includes Hitler making a speech, post-war political speeches, East German parliament, Walter Ulbricht, and East German military parade.
Footage of pre- and post-war German industrial activity, German agriculture, housing and commercial developments, workers leaving a factory, war refugees, and soldiers marching along country road.
Miscellaneous footage of German education, students, classroom scenes, and a school trip to the Berlin Wall.

Footage of a NAZI parade, soldiers leading civilians away, Hitler, concentration camps, Hitler and staff meeting, invasion of Poland, refugees fleeing, Yalta Conference, German army in France, invasion of Czechoslovakia, and the bombing of Berlin.
Miscellaneous footage depicting German education, Berlin Wall, and German children at play.

Footage of sculptor Bernard Hellinger and his art institute, officials of U.S., France, and Great Britain at meeting discussing reunification of Germany, NATO troops, and miscellaneous scenes of vacation spots for West Germans.
Miscellaneous footage of sports competition, Chancellor Adenauer campaigning, election speeches, and voting. Also shots of Sandburg, a south German town untouched by the war.
Footage depicting post-war German industry, scenes of large chemical factory and workers, scenes of workers filling the streets after Adenauer wins election.

Films #108-117 were filmed for TVC program "Silent Heritage." They include footage of interviews with American Indian leaders, scenes from reservation communities, and traditional crafts. (See card files of Michigan Media for detailed description.)Features: Clyde Warrior, Edison Realbird, George Heron, Herb Blatchford

Footage filmed for the Series I program "Silent Heritage." Includes clips of Pres. Johnson speaking, several Indian tribal leaders, Indian people working in a basket factory, and Indian Affairs Commissioner Robert C. Bennett. Features: Lyndon Johnson, Pres., Clyde Warrior, Blatchford, E. Realbird, G.Heron, R.Nakai, Bennett, Indian Commissioner

Miscellaneous footage of Ann Arbor scenes including shots of children playing football in a park, crowd heading toward Stadium, people at a pre-game picnic. Shots of Bell Tower, Angell Hall, people entering a church, Kelsey Museum. (Color original.)
Underwater footage of marine life on ocean bottom and coral reef, good shots of jelly-fish, filmed by cameraman in scuba gear.

Film produced by Westinghouse Undersea Division showing a Westinghouse mini-submarine used in ocean floor research, exterior shots of sub on ocean floor, interior shots of scientists working in sub, sub being launched from a ship.
Footage of people, street scenes and buildings in Moscow and Kiev including women sweeping streets, children in class, Red Square, and Lenin's tomb.

A U.S. Armed Forces Screen report on Russia and its peoples includes footage of the Russian countryside, city buildings and street scenes, factories, and folk dancing, also war footage from World War II.
Japanese Wedding.; Footage of a Japanese wedding ceremony.
Russian Army training film shows various Soviet forces and the training they go through. This is a Russian film with voice over commentary in English. Apparently distributed by the U.S. Army.
These films consist of newsreel and documentary type footage acquired by the TVC for use in a television series about post-war Japan.

These films consist of newsreel and documentary type footage acquired by the TVC for use in a television series about post-war Japan. There are many short clips of Japanese and American military and political leaders, war damage, social and cultural

life, industry and economic activities, family life, and agriculture. Films were obtained from Japanese National Archives, U.S. War Dept. and other sources. All are silent and black and white. There are negatives, work prints, and air prints.
For more detailed listing of images on each film see the "Film File" card file in box of the Michigan Media collection.

Japan at the End of the War.; Includes footage of aerial bombing, prisoners of war, W. Averell Harriman meeting Douglas MacArthur, political rallies and crowd scenes, and shots of U.S. troops and military equipment during occupation. Features: W. Averell Harriman, Douglas MacArthur

U.S. Soldiers in Japan During the War and Occupation.; Includes some battle scenes in cities and villages, U.S. 1st cavalry in Tokyo, refugees, marching soldiers, soldiers running through village littered with corpses.
Rice Farming in Japan.; Shots of man plowing rice field with water buffalo, rice farming from planting to harvest to grinding and cooking, Japanese dressed in traditional costumes.
Japan During the War.; Includes footage of Japanese soldiers, city scenes, cotton mill, children in school, and religious worship.

Japanese lifestyle, dress, dancing, traditional physical exercises, and homes are depicted in footage from Japanese National Archives. Also shots of aircraft carriers in the Pacific, fighting on land and water.

Miscellaneous scenes of many political meetings and speeches to large crowds, factory workers, agricultural workers, coal miners, various military scenes, children in school and recreational activities including wrestling, dancing and horse racing.

Includes footage from a U.S. Army film "Road to Democracy" depicting the smashing of the Japanese war machine and the establishment of a peaceful, constitutional government. Also footage of Japanese life and work under new government.

Yamadas at Work.; Footage from the Japanese National Archives of industrial and commercial activities including scenes of ships loading and unloading in port, a new ship being launched, and several factories.
Suzuki Family.; Footage from Japanese National Archives and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs depicts Japanese family life.
The Nuki Buraku School.; Footage from Japan National Archives includes scenes of children in school, family life, farm work, and countryside scenes.
Tokyo Family Life.: Miscellaneous footage of Japanese family life and ritual including family meals, drinking and dining at a wedding, shots of woman doing housework, scenes of old and new houses.
Family working in rice fields, plowing, planting and reaping.
The Nuki Buraku School Wedding.; Scenes before and after a wedding in traditional wedding dress.
Scenes of industrial activity including machinery in a factory, an assembly line, and mining.
Miscellaneous scenes of Japanese and U.S. military, a parade, farming, mining, children in school, native dances, and use of an abacus.
Miscellaneous scenes from Japanese life in post-war Japan including citizens voting, a parade, construction of modern buildings, rice farming, oyster diving, baseball, and city scenes.
U.S. War Department film of U.S. troops landing on Japan, and a variety of war scenes. Also shots of Tokyo.
Miscellaneous scenes of urban life in post-war Japan.
Footage depicts the life of Japanese women as they work alongside men in the fields and the business world.
Film about mercury poisoning in two Japanese fishing villages.

Footage from visits to various German cities during celebrations honoring the victims of the June 17, 1953 Berlin revolt. Pres. Heuss presents an award to Thornton Wilder, Konrad Adenauer opens a national garden show.
Football and J-Hop scenes. 2 reels, 1 of 1926, and 1 of 1927.
Film of UM Athletic Director. Features: H.O. "Fritz" Crisler, UM-Ath., Director
Footage of buildings, street scenes, countryside, and people in Moscow, Leningrad, Tashkent, Samarkand, and Soviet Georgia.

Miscellaneous footage of Reed City, Michigan, filmed for the program "Rx - Reed City" (Series B #616), includes country and city scenes, meetings with the flag displayed, city streets, lovely old homes, downtown scenes. (A roll neg.)
City, scenes of trees and trains, Reed City Hospital, doctors looking at small slides. (B roll neg.)
Misc. pieces of film. Dearborn/Ford, Pres. Hatcher, Mr. Dey. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres., Subendra Kumar Dey
Sign, "John Chavis--Early 19th Century Free Negro preacher and teacher of both races." Memorial park, people and children.

Footage filmed for TVC program on UM - Tuskeegee cooperative program. Shots of rural Alabama scene, young people having classes on lawn, children dancing the Virginia Reel, school bldgs. and homes., Tuskeegee Institute sign. (b/w orig.)
Footage of various instruments at the UM Phoenix Memorial Nuclear Laboratory.
Exterior shot of Phoenix Memorial Laboratory, footage of men gathered around the cobalt reactor, shots of instruments and apparatus.

did.unittitle: Auto Industry and Old Time Racing
did.abstract: Scenes from the early days of automobiles, includes old cars, old store fronts, billboard, horse buggies, old car advertisements, international auto race 1921 and 1936.
Dr. Barnard being interviewed while visiting Michigan. (kinescope neg., card file note says "1/2 hr print rejected for tv use") Features: Dr. Christiaan Barnard
Footage of UM nurses outdoors, medical building in background.

Footage from the Ford Archives includes cars coming off early assembly line, family out for a car ride, traffic problems involving horse and buggy and automobiles, scenes of "Uncle Henry" working on a Model T. (apparently a narration on original.)

Footage of U.S. in early 1900s, street scenes, amusement park, train depot, cars and boats, rallies and parades, war recruiting, women working in airplane factories, ship building, "Spirit of St.Louis." (From Ford Film Collection in Nat. Archives.)
Two nurses are filmed beneath an apple tree. Different shots and angles of these two conversing, closes with them walking away, Medical Center buildings in background.

Film footage of historical photographs of the University of Michigan campus including laboratories, classrooms, faculty, administrators, musical groups, and student activities including the pushball game, filmed for use in sesquicentennial film.
Tom Harmon is filmed as he walks into IM hallway, stops in front of display case and talks. (Filmed for Series I program "UM-150", very scratchy film.)Features: Tom Harmon

On the spot night coverage of burning and looting, scenes from an emergency center in a Detroit hosp., newsmen interviewing people on the streets, arrests, National Guardsmen, moving of large group of prisoners, press conf. of city & state officials. Features: George Romney. Jerome Cavanaugh
Man setting and checking test equipment, placing monkey in equipment. Monkey in test.

Accident scenes, ambulance drivers with lights flashing, injured person or persons on the ground, car on its side, police interviewing witnesses, helicopter to U Hospital Emergency room, doctor is interviewed.

Footage depicting the research, production and distribution functions carried on by modern pharmaceutical companies, shows equipment and methods uses in quality control of new products. (Filmed for Series I program "Take as Directed. No. 7.")

Footage shows UM football team and campus around 1925 includes shots of coach Fielding Yost, star player Benny Oosterbaan, 87,000 fans in Michigan Stadium including President Little and Henry Tappan Hall. Features: Fielding Harris Yost, UM-Athl.; Benny Oosterbaan, UM-Ath.; C.C. Little, UM-Pres., Henry Tappan Hall
Random shots of UM Football Team practicing without Jerseys, shots of coaches instructing players, players blocking and running a couple of plays. (Original footage for 1970 Big 10 preview.")
Footage of UM football coach Bo Schembechler in his office, displays plaque naming him coach of the year. Features: Glen "Bo" Schembechler, UM-Ath.
Footage of UM football coach Bo Schembechler and his assistants conducting football practice. Features: Glen "Bo" Schembechler, UM-Ath.

The following films were produced or collected by or for the University of Michigan Alumni Association during the 1920s and 1930s. They document a variety of university events, buildings, and personalities. The films have been cut up and spliced. They are mostly b/w but there are sections of color film. Some of this footage was used in the films "We Came to Ann Arbor" and "Women Students at the University of Michigan in the 1930s." Nine small films were compiled onto two reels and transferred to Beta SP tape by Allied Films, in 1997. The digital files made from the Beta tapes by SceneSavers, 2009) Listed below are the two compiled reels, followed by descriptions of the original small reels.
Compiled reel of footage, form the 1920s and 1930s, includes original Alumni Association reels FF-210-a through FF-210-e described below.

physdesc.physfacet: Beta SP dub, color b/w, sil, 00:32:33

did.abstract: Compiled reel of footage, form the 1920s and 1930s, includes original Alumni Association reels FF-210-f through FF-210-I described below.

physdesc.physfacet: Beta SP dub, color b/w, silent, 00:23:41

did.abstract: Footage includes Pres. Ruthven on horseback, train station, campus policeman, Angell Hall, U. Hospital, Observatory, various deans and professors, aerial of campus, Michigamua initiation, Big 10 track meet, students on Diag, snowstorm on South U. Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres. ; Fielding Yost, UM-Ath.

Game and practice footage of the 1925 football team, including some slow motion shots of plays, close-ups of Bennie Friedman, Bennie Oosterbaan, Wallie Weber, and Lewis Gilbert. (Dr. Wiles' film. An REO-GRAM production?) Features: Bennie Friedman, Bennie Oosterbaan, Wallie Weber, Lewis Gilbert

Footage includes football game in nearly empty Michigan Stadium, aerials of campus, a tennis match, Michigamua initiation - smoking ceremonial pipe on President's House lawn, UM-ROTC members in class and on parade, and students on Palmer Field.

Film includes footage of Biological Station - Camp Douglas, campus honor society initiation, track team, construction of Burton Tower and installation of carillon, Marching Band, alumni reunion, parade on State St. Features: George La Rue, UM-Zool.

Footage of baseball game on Ferry Field, graduates marching past Econ. Building and assembling on Diag, golf team, Old Mason and Haven Halls, women's dormitories, Burton funeral procession (1925?), football practice, Marching Band, women's archery.

Footage of faculty members (unidentified), "Fall Games" tug-of-war across Huron River, field hockey match, football game footage, officers of the Alumni Association, women in front of the Women's League, graduates in procession, track meet, parade. Features: T. Hawley Tapping, UM-Alum. ;Lucile Beach Conger, UM-Alum. ;Robert O. Morgan, UM-Alum.

Footage of deans and professors, Illinois football game, football crowd, Louis Elbel conducting "The Victors", Marching Band, 1898 football team in stands, homecoming displays, Christmas breakfast at Martha Cook, women students at Alumnae House features: Margaret Bell, UM-PE; Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.;Alice Lloyd; Shirley Smith, UM-VP; Louis Elbel; Henry Anderson, UM-Eng.;Edward Krauss, UM-Pharm.

Footage of Ruthven on horseback, freshman orientation and registration, forestry class on field trip, aerials of campus, Old Mason Hall, women's dorms, Yost Arena, University Council leaving Angell Hall, field hockey match, baseball, football, track. Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.

Footage of students skiing, tobogganning, bowling, and playing ping-pong, Senior Society Banquet in the League, May Festival events, Choral Union and Philadelphia Symphony, Mothers' Day at Mosher-Jordan, commencement, Jack Wolin diving in men's pool. Features: Myra B. Jordan, UM-Dean of Women ;Jack Wolin

A newsreel by Telenews of the Day Prod. features Pres. Kennedy announcing selection of G. Mennen Williams as Ass't Sec of State for African Affairs and Robert McNamara as Secretary of Defense. Also a feature on "Operation Deep Freeze" a scientific Features: G. Mennen Williams, Robert McNamara, John Kennedy, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Richard Bird

Expedition to Antarctica. Includes historical film of Robert Scott's failed attempt to reach the south pole and of several of Richard Bird's expeditions, Pres. Roosevelt welcoming Bird home, and footage of "Little America" U.S. Antarctic camp.

A newsreel by Telenews of the Day Prod. features dedication of a memorial to Robert Hutchins Goddard at Goddard Space Flight Center, includes rare footage of Goddard's early rocketry experiments and interview with Mrs. Goddard and Werner Von Braun. Features: Robert Hutchins Goddard, Werner Von Braun
Footage of cicadas emerging from ground, in trees etc. includes extreme close-ups. Filmed for TVC Series B program "Sounds of Cicadas".

Film of Henry Bretton interviewing James K. Pollock on the current German election campaign. Pollock discusses the Adenauer campaign and what the election could mean for U.S. foreign policy. (Apparently filmed for a TVC program.)Features: James K. Pollock, UM-Pol. Sci.;Henry Bretton, UM-Pol. Sci.

The following films were made at the time of a conference of scientists, educators, journalists, and government officials at the UM on the technical, political, and social consequences of the development of nuclear power.

Duane Roller.;A physicist who is editor of Scientific Monthly discusses the impact of the atomic age on science journalism, stressing the importance of openness and intellectual honesty and problems created by the need for secrecy in atomic research. Features: Duane Roller

Jerome Luntz.; Editor of Nucleonics Magazine discusses the impact of the atomic age on information and communication in society, the public's need to gain a basic understanding of nuclear energy, and the impact of secrecy needs in atomic research. Features: Jerome Luntz

Studio interviews and film of proceedings of the conference on nuclear energy held at the University of Michigan. (This consists of several reels of negatives, workprints, and other footage used in TVC programs on the conference.)

Alexander Ruthven discusses the University of Michigan's development council and the Alumni Fund, interviews with several student's who received financial aid from the Alumni Fund. Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.
Writer Frank O'Connor, in his office, reads from his own work - a story about his school days. Features: Frank O'Connor

A film explaining the development, testing, and use of the Salk polio vaccine featuring Jonas Salk, Thomas Francis and other leading figures in polio research. The film was aimed at doctors. Sponsored by Eli Lilly Company and includes footage of Salk inoculating child, Closed Circuit on Dumont Network. Features: Jonas Salk ;Thomas Francis, UM-Med. ;Basil O'Connor ;Hart E. Van Ryper (Note: the film was spliced out of order, the streaming file has been edited to correct the order.) (Copyright to the film is held by the Eli Lllly Company.)
Appears to be kinescope negative of 218-b. Includes footage of Salk inoculating child Features: Jonas Salk ;Thomas Francis, UM-Med. ;Basil O'Connor ;Hart E. Van Ryper

Several reels of film from the Series H program "Beaumont Memorial" on the dedication of the Mackinac Island memorial to pioneer physician William Beaumont, including a nearly complete version of the program, also, footage of the ceremony, Features: Emil Lorch, UM-Arch.(See also Archives film number 458 for additional footage of the dedication ceremony.

Several reels of film from the Series H program "Beaumont Memorial" on the dedication of the Mackinac Island memorial to pioneer physician William Beaumont, including a nearly complete version of the program, also, footage of the ceremony, Features: Emil Lorch, UM-Arch.

an interview with Emil Lorch consultant on the historic site restoration, interview with Dr. Frederick Coller about the significance of Beaumont's work and the development of the memorial, and footage of the memorial and restored building and museum.

Footage of Thailand's ambassador to the U.S. on a tour of the UM Phoenix Memorial Laboratory, includes his arrival on North Campus, shots of the laboratory and several engineering professors, and footage of North Campus construction sites.

Thai ambassador and UM engineering professors discuss the UM Phoenix Memorial Project for study of the peaceful uses of atomic energy, Thailand's interest in nuclear power, and possible training of Thai engineers at UM.

Film footage of the dedication ceremonies for the Ford Nuclear Reactor at the University of Michigan, includes footge of comments by Harlan Hatcher, Ralph Sawyer, and several engineering professors. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres. ;Ralph Sawyer, UM-VP
Continues coverage of the dedication ceremonies for the Ford Nuclear Reactor.
Footage of the Ford Nuclear Reactor at the University of Michigan, at the time of its dedication, includes shots of the reactor pool, rods, and instrument panels.
Continues coverage of the dedication ceremonies for the Ford Nuclear Reactor.
Continues coverage of the dedication ceremonies for the Ford Nuclear Reactor.
Continues coverage of the dedication ceremonies for the Ford Nuclear Reactor. Actual footage of the reactor and its lab.
Footage of Flint Community College campus, and ceremony marking its becoming the University of Michigan Flint Campus, and construction of UM-Flint.
Continues footage of University of Michigan Flint dedication ceremony, Harlan Hatcher delivering address. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.
Brief footage of UM-Flint dedication ceremony and of Harlan Hatcher and college officials in the lobby. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.
Footage of a parade down State Street in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
Footage of University of Michigan class registration in Waterman Gymnasium.
Several women's choral groups perform at the annual "Lantern Night" sponsored by the Women's Athletic Association.
Footage of marching bands performing at Michigan Stadium on high school band day.
Footage of a half-time show by the UM Marching Band at Michigan Stadium. Features: Marching Band
Footage of a performance by Michifish, the UM synchronized swimming team.

Film of tour of Phoenix Memorial Laboratory by U Nu of Burma, includes a discussion of the Phoenix Project for research in peaceful use of atomic energy, use of radiation in medicine, and the possibility of sending Burmese students to UM. Features: U Nu
Continues coverage of U Nu's tour of the Phoenix Lab and of a reception for him at the Clements Library. Features: U Nu

Footage of an interview in which James Rae refutes allegations that UM athletes, football player Ron Kramer in particular, had received improper financial aid through a loophole in Big 10 regulations. Features: James Rae, UM-Med. ;Arthur Brandon, UM-Jour.
Footage of graduation ceremony in Michigan Stadium, includes shots of the procession and awarding of diplomas.
Brief footage of the installation of the donor plaque in the lobby of the Phoenix Memorial Laboratory and a demonstration of equipment for remote handling of radioactive material.
Film footage of performance by massed bands at Michigan Stadium on annual high school band day.
Japanese ambassador to the United States visits the library of the Center for Japanese Studies at the University of Michigan, discusses the work of the Center.
Film of the facilities, equipment, and staff of the University of Michigan Television Center shows staff and technicians at work during production of a television program.
Footage of UM Naval ROTC members working in classrooms and training on anti-aircraft guns and other equipment, also short footage of the Air Force ROTC band.
Footage at what was apparently an open house at Pioneer High School, includes shot of the exterior and of classrooms and laboratories and an assembly in the gymnasium.
Footage of students on the Diag and steps of General Library.
Footage of facilities and staff at the old Out-Patient Clinic of the University of Michigan Hospital, includes shots of doctors examining patients, the registration desk, and laboratories.
Footage from the Boy Scout Leader National Training Meeting held on the UM campus, includes interviews with the chief scout administrator and Harold Stassen. Features: Harold Stassen
Footage of the Boy Scout Leader National Training meeting held on UM campus, includes shots of a meeting in Rackham Auditorium, displays on the Diag, and an encampment on Ferry Field.
Footage of professors and students working in the zoology laboratory. (5 reels of negatives, ca. 1200 feet.)

Film footage of classroom scenes, class registration in Haven Hall, and a convocation in Rackham Auditorium. Apparently filmed for recruiting film for the College of Literature, Sciences, and the Arts.

Footage of classrooms and laboratories, a group of faculty members in a meeting, several interviews of freshman students as part of the Principal - Freshman Conferences in which high school principals interview freshmen.

Footage of the press conference announcing the results of the Salk polio vaccine tests. Salk describes the field tests and analyzes the results. Jonas Salk, Tommy Francis and Basil O'Connor answer questions. (Not complete coverage.)Features: Jonas Salk ;Thomas Francis, UM-SPH; Basil O'Connor

Footage from the press conference announcing the results of the Salk polio vaccine tests. Mostly shots of press gallery and crowd, shots of passing out report some of Salk and others at podium and informal, exteriors of Rackham. Features: Jonas Salk ;Thomas Francis, UM-SPH; BASIL O'Connor

Incomplete footage of a press conference by Thomas Francis, director of the Salk polio vaccine field tests, discusses methodology but not results of the tests. This was held a week prior to announcement of the test results. Features: Thomas Francis, UM-Med.

Footage of Slausson Jr. High School's production of the original operetta "The Bell and the Bellhop." Also interviews with principal Harold Logan and music teacher Merton Kellog about producing the musical.

Miscellaneous footage of the UM Women's Hospital maternity section, includes shots of patient rooms, examination rooms, laboratories, delivery room, and kitchen facilities, also footage of doctors and nurses attending patients.

Film footage of several psychological and physiological experiments on monkeys, rats, and rabbits conducted by University of Michigan researchers. Include shots of laboratories and scientific equipment and researchers at work.
Devalois.; Footage of experiment conducted by UM researcher Russell Devalois. Features: Russell Devalois
Domino.; Footage of an experiment conducted by Edward Domino of the UM Medical School Department of Pharmacology. Features: Edward Domino, UM-Med.
Coombs.; Footage of an experiment conducted by UM psychology professor Clyde Coombs. Features: Clyde H. Coombs, UM-Psych.
McCleary, Meyers.; Footage of experiment conducted by UM professors Robert McCleary and Muriel Meyers. Features: Robert McCleary, UM-Psych ;Muriel Meyers, UM-Med.
Olds.; Footage of experiment conducted by UM psychology professor James Olds. Features: James Olds, UM-Psych.
Walker.; Footage of experiment conducted by UM psychology professor Edward Walker. Features: Edward Walker, UM-Psych.
Footage of experiments on brain cells conducted by UM psychology professors.

Twelve reels of film negatives, consists of documentary footage of "Operation Deep Freeze," a scientific expediting to Antarctica. Shot by UM Television Center Staff. Includes footage of camp at "Little America", experiments, and scenery, sea voyage, and Antarctic scenes.

Two reels of magnetic sound track of press conference and ceremony announcing gift of Fairlane Mansion from Ford Motor Company to the University of Michigan for establishment of the UM Dearborn Campus. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

Films #283 - 297 consist of interview footage with participants in the first international symposium on arms control sponsored by the University of Michigan. Participants included government officials, representatives of defense contractors, academic specialists in disarmament research, and peace activists. Some of this footage was incorporated into the Series B programs "Report on Arms Control." Most of the films include negatives, workprints and magnetic sound tracks.
McNaughton.; Defense Department official discusses Pentagon weapons planning and arms control. Features: John T. McNaughton
McNaughton.
Publisher of "World Peace Report" discusses efforts to promote and disseminate scholarly research in the field of peace studies.
Hudson.
Aaron. Director of Arms Control at the Pentagon discusses the arms negotiation process.
Karpov.
Karpov.
Taylor.; Chairman of the National Research Council on Peace Studies talks about the council's activities and the role of peace organizations in the peace and disarmament movement.
Taylor.

Morse.; Member of the Long Range Planning Group of the Aero-Jet Corp., a major defense contractor, gives a weapons industry's perspective on the arms control process and the possible economic and social ramifications of disarmament.
Foster. First director of the U.S. Arms Control and Disarmament Agency discusses the founding and purpose of the agency. Features: William C. Foster
Foster.
Bechoefer.; A State Department official with long experience negotiating with the Russians discusses the process of arms control negotiation. Features: Bernard Bechoefer
Melman. Interview with arms control expert and Pentagon critic Seymor Melman on the impact of the arms race on international affairs and the U.S. economy. Features: Seymour Melman
Melman.

Melman.; Arms control expert and Pentagon critic Seymour Melman discusses the adverse effects of the arms race on the U.S. economy and the country's balance of payments and emphasizes the political and economic motives for disarmament.
Melman.
Lentz.; A peace activist and former university professor discusses his involvement in the disarmament movement following World War II. Features: Ed Lentz
Lentz.
Phelps.; Director of the Institute for Defense Analysis, discusses the role of academic research in arms development and the disarmament process.
Phelps.;
Lough.; Sound track only, UM professor Thomas Lough, on leave with the U.S. Arms Control and Disarmament Agency discusses his work with the agency.
Lough.
Matteson; A policy analyst for the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency discusses his research and work for the agency.
Matteson.
Humphrey. Senator Hubert Humphrey discusses the genesis of the U.S. Arms Control and Disarmament Agency and the politics involved in its establishment. Features: Hubert Humphrey

Footage of the Michigamua initiation, includes shots of the members and initiates in Indian costume, in Union Tower, smoking pipe with Pres. Ruthven, and parading through campus. (original footage once held by the Alumni Association)Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.

did.unittitle: Alumni Association: Rope Day 1941 Michigamua circa 1941
did.abstract: Footage of the Michigamua initiation ceremony, ca. 1941. Includes shots of members painting themselves with "war paint", smoking "peace pipe" with Pres. Ruthven, and ceremony at tree near Graduate Library. (orig. footage once held by Alumni Assoc.)Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.

Brief footage of UM football game (Ohio State 1938?), extended footage of marching band performance, crowd shots, fans on the field, and footage of a Big Ten track meet at Ferry Field. (original footage that was once held by the Alumni Association.)Features: Marching Band

Footage of the Michigamua initiation ceremony, ca. 1939. Includes shots of members painting themselves with "war paint", smoking "peace pipe" with Pres. Ruthven, and ceremony at tree near Graduate Library. Features: Alexander Ruthven, UM-Pres.

scopecontent.p: The Audio Visual Education Center, originally part of the University Extension Division's Visual Education Bureau and mainly a film distribution service, produces a variety of instructional films and promotional films for the university and also produced some on a contract basis for non-university clients.

did.abstract: Examines changes in American's life expectancy, lifestyle, work and retirement, and planning for an extended prime of life. Features: Clark Tibbits, UM-Geron.

did.unittitle: Analog Computer & its Application to Differential Equations 1963
did.abstract: Demonstration of the use of the analog computer to solve differential equations. Includes musical segments by pioneer electronic music composers Robert Ashley and Gordan Mummer. Features: Wilfred Kaplan, UM Math

A University High School (affiliated with UM) class looks at the question of prejudice and discrimination from a sociological point of view and discusses the economics of farming and the knowledge one needs to farm.

Film of surgical procedure for vein grafts is demonstrated and explained. This technique was developed at UM and led to the feasibility of heart bypass operations. Dietrich later worked with heart surgeon Micheal DeBakey. Features: Edward Dietrich, St. Joseph Hosp.
Filmed highlights of the Band Day performances of UM Marching band at half-time of UM football game. Features: Marching Band

UM Marching Band Director George Cavender is featured in a look at the work of a university band director, UM Marching Band drills and performances at Rose Parade, Rose Bowl, and Disneyland. Features UM's last all male Band. Film won five awards. Features: George Cavender, UM-Music

Instructional film on floor care as means of controlling bacterial contamination in hospitals, produced in cooperation with UM Hospital and H.G. Fuller Co. Includes numerous shots of the old University Hospital.

Physicians from the UM Medical Center's Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation demonstrate various prosthetic devices and adjustments made as a child grows and learns to control his extremities. Features: Leonard Bender, UM-Med. ; Gerald O'Oconnor, UM-Med.

Hatcher, who worked closely with AVEC on script, discusses the many areas of development and growth at the University of Michigan over the years 1946-1956. Excellent footage of campus buildings, laboratories, classrooms, and student activities. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.

Demonstration of the specialized activities and equipment for daily living by four severely impaired young adults with the goal of attending school away from home. Footage from the UM Med. Center Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Dept. Features: James W. Rae, UM-Med.
Looks at the history of metal casting and the development of the casting process. Footage of Ford Motor Co. die casting operation. Winner of Gold Camera Award, U.S. Industrial Film Festival.

physdesc.physfacet: 16mm film, color, sound, ca. 00:30:00, Neg. # 191, Pos. # 40

did.abstract: Footage of a Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering lab course on the principles of digital logic and computer interfacing technique. Features: Eric Aupperle, UM-Eng.

Footage of activities celebrating the 100th anniversary of the University of Michigan College of Engineering and the dedication of the Mortimer Cooley Memorial Lab, including banquets, speeches, ribbon cuttings, and ceremonies at Michigan Stadium. Features: Harlan Harcher, UM-Pres.; George Brown, UM-Eng.; Wilbur Pierpont, UM-VP; Charles E. Wilson

did.unittitle: Excision and Replacement of the Heart 1963
did.abstract: Film of a pioneering UM Medical Center surgical procedure to remove and replace the heart of a dog. Berkeley's surgical experiments at the UM contributed to the development of human heart transplant surgery. Features: Kelly Berkeley, UM-Med.

Film produced for UM Extension Service and Detroit Edison, a training film for emergency personnel on safety measures for handling electrical powerlines and wires. An award winning film. More prints of this film were sold than any other AVEC title. Features: George W. Williams, UM-TVC

did.unittitle: First Aid for Head and Neck Injuries in Football 1976
did.abstract: Award winning film on the proper first aid techniques in the treatment of head and neck injuries in football. Schneider, an expert on sports injuries, examines the symptoms of various head and spinal cord injuries and the proper treatment for each. Features: Richard C. Schneider, UM-Med., ; Lindsey McClear, UM-Ath.

A look at the development of a chick embryo and its first heart beats. Produced by the UM Anatomy Dept. and Baldwin Bird Laboratory of Cleveland. An early scientific / instructional film. (Part of a series titled Microcinema Studies, silent, b/w.) Features: Bradley Patten, UM-Med.
Excerpts from the full production of the same title.

did.unittitle: First Hundred Years: Engineering College Centennial 1954
did.abstract: A student from first UM engineering course takes a 100 year nap, on waking he is given tour of College of Engineering facilities. Shows labs and classroom scenes, describes variety of research being conducted, footage of distinguished professors. Features: George G. Brown, Louis Baier, Myron Nichols, Walter Lay, A.D. Moore, all UM-Eng.

Documents the prostheses available for various levels of arm amputation. Intended for physicians, physical therapists, social workers, and medical students. Winner of Honors Certificate at 1967 American Film Festival. Features: Leonard Bender, UM-Med.

Decribes the work of the University of Michigan Health Service, how it cooperates with other UM units to provide for the safety and health of students. Footage of the old University Hospital. Script by Daniel Waldron, cinematography George Voellmar.

Events of Band Day at UM, 12000 high school band members perform at half-time at Michigan Stadium. Karl King leads the massed band, 1500 majorettes entertain, UM Marching Band performs a soft-shoe routine. Features: Karl King
The film won five major awards including the CINE, highest in U.S. for documentary film. Was also selected as U.S. representative in the Vancouver Film Festival.
Additional footage of performance of UM marching Band and 38 high school bands at half-time of UM football game. Features: Karl King

An early AVEC production in cooperation with College of Engineering and the Michigan Bureau of Industrial Health. Demonstrates the variety and proper use of industrial ventilating systems. Only film known to exist on the topic. Features: 77
A demonstration of how the power of combinational logic networks is extended to include the capability to store information.

Combinational Logic.; A PDP-9 computer graphics system integrated with a digital analysis program is used to demonstrate the operation of the basic digital logic elements. Includes footage of computer hardware.

did.unittitle: Knowledge, Wisdom and the Courage to Serve 1967
did.abstract: The story of the UM, the educational process at work, featuring comment by distinguished faculty and alumni and discussion of research programs, a UM sesquicentennial film. Footage of campus buildings and student activities. Score by Robert Ashley. Features: Edward White, James McDivitt, Alice Hamilton, Lynn Townsend, Arthur Miller

did.unittitle: Locks of Saulte Ste. Marie, The 1955
did.abstract: A brief look at the history of the Soo area focusing on the development of commerce and the locks. Produced for centennial of the Locks, it is the definitive film on the subject. Pres. Hatcher encouraged its production and attended the premier. Features: 40

The University of Michigan Marching Band's preparation for and performance in the 1971 Rose Bowl. This film received the Silver Cindy Award. Features: William Revelli, UM-Music; George Cavender, UM-Music; UM Marching Band
Original film footage for the film "Marching for Roses" features The University of Michigan Marching Band's preparation for and performance in the 1970 Rose Bowl. Features: UM Marching Band

Designed to give pre-law students a view of legal education, this film visits law classrooms, a mock trial, the Law Review office, the Case Club, and Lawyers Club housing. Footage of Law faculty. Good aerial shots of the Law Quad and UM campus.

Demonstration of a time-shared computer system available through UM to assist businessmen with marketing decisions. A PDPH computer and Digital Equipment display device with pen light controls make it easy to perform regression analysis.

Uses cine photo-micrography to examine the physical characteristics of metals during machining, structural parts of metals such as grain boundaries, impurity inclusions, and Knoop hardness indentations during milling. Features: Joseph Datsko, UM-Eng.

Describes and illustrates the nature of serious and fatal head, neck, and spinal injuries in amateur and professional football players. Footage of injuries obtained from all over the country. Film led to many rules changes to protect players. Features: Richard Schneider, UM-Med.

Film documents the proceedings of the state constitutional convention during drafting of the Michigan constitution. Footage of hearings and debates. A condensation of many hours of filming. A joint production of UM, Michigan State and Wayne State.
Raw footage of the 1962 Michigan constitutional convention, from AVEC production "Michigan Can Lead the Way." Consists of many small rolls of film that are not well identified.

Pre-game and half-time performance by UM Marching Band including a tribute to the UM Phoenix project. Also includes footage on the decade of progress by the Phoenix project with shots of labs and activities funded through the Phoenix project. Features: UM Marching Band

A promotional film for the UM, includes footage of campus buildings, student classroom and social activities, the Marching Band, homecoming, Michigras and graduation. Many "Michigan" songs. Footage of the Ann Arbor community. Music by Floyd Werle. Features: Harlan Hatcher, UM-Pres.; Edward R. Murrow
Footage of the Michigras Parade, from the era of great student participation. Includes floats, displays, and crowds along State St. and South University. (Original color footage.);

A pioneering use of film to study blood circulation in live laboratory animals under a magnification of up to 2000 times. Demonstrates techniques for preparing rats for the microscope stage, micropunctures of appendix membrane show blood clotting. Features: Giovanni Racugglia, UM-Med.; Frank Bethel, UM-Med.
Original footage of microscope shots used in Dr. Raccuglgia's film.

A film on how the mind works in creating an image of the world, how the thinking, planning, imagining processes work and are related to physical coordination. A typical film produced by AVEC for use in public schools. Music by George Cacciopo.

did.unittitle: Morphine Physical Dependence in the Monkey
did.abstract: Produced with the UM Dept. of Pharmacology, film presents a panel discussion on drug abuse and footage of laboratory experiments on the effects of morphine on monkeys. Shots of the UM monkey colony. Features: Maurice Seevers, UM-Med.; Nathan Eddy UM-Med.

did.unittitle: Ninety-five Percent Pancreatectomy for Chronic Pancreatitis
did.abstract: Film of UM Medical Center surgical procedure for a 95% pancreatectomy for recurring pancreatitis. This procedure was developed at UM Hospital which is believed to be the only place it has been performed. Features: Charles Frey, UM-Med.

Film produced for the U.S. Postal Service as part of an ISR study on postal procedures. Examines the operation of the UM mail service and illustrates ISR survey techniques. Features: Doug Barnett, UM-Mail; Jim Wessel, UM-Mail

did.unittitle: Old Spain on the Caribbean: Trinidad de Cuba circa 1953
